title: Design ITransformationService and Data Contracts
description: Define the C# interface `ITransformationService` in the Application layer. Define input and output DTOs/models for passing data to and from the service.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: An `ITransformationService.cs` interface file is created with a method like `Task<JsonNode> ExecuteAsync(string script, JsonNode data)`. Interface is placed in the `Application` project. Code is peer-reviewed and approved.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Establishes the core component for executing JavaScript transformations.

title: Implement JintTransformationService Core Logic
description: Create the `JintTransformationService` in the Infrastructure layer. Implement the `ExecuteAsync` method to instantiate a Jint engine, set the input JsonNode as a global variable, execute the script, and return the result.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: Service correctly instantiates `Jint.Engine`. A `JsonNode` from .NET is correctly exposed as a JavaScript object. The script's return value is correctly retrieved.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Establishes the core component for executing JavaScript transformations.

title: Develop Unit Tests for JintTransformationService
description: Create a suite of xUnit tests to validate the core functionality of the `JintTransformationService`, covering adding, removing, and modifying properties on a JSON object.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: Test cases for add, remove, and modify properties pass. Code coverage exceeds 80%.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Ensures the reliability of the core transformation logic.

title: Implement Configuration Model for Sandbox Options
description: Create a strongly-typed C# class for sandbox settings (Timeout, MemoryLimit, etc.) and bind it to a new section in `appsettings.json` using the .NET Options pattern.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: A `SandboxSettings.cs` class is created. The class is registered in `Program.cs`. A new section is added to `appsettings.json`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
deployment_notes: Requires update to production configuration files.
business_value: Protects the system from denial-of-service attacks and malicious code execution.

title: Integrate Sandbox Options into Jint Engine Configuration
description: Update `JintTransformationService` to accept the `SandboxSettings` via dependency injection. Use these settings to configure the `Jint.Engine` options for each execution, including disabling CLR access.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: Service constructor is updated to receive `IOptions<SandboxSettings>`. The `Engine` instantiation is updated. The `options.TimeoutInterval`, `options.MemoryLimit`, etc. are set from the settings object. CLR access is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests and security code review
business_value: Protects the system from denial-of-service attacks and malicious code execution.

title: Develop Unit Tests for Sandbox Constraints
description: Create a suite of xUnit tests, each designed to trigger a specific sandbox violation and assert that the correct exception is thrown by the service.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: A test with a `while(true){}` script asserts that a `Jint.Runtime.TimeoutException` is thrown. A test for memory limit asserts `MemoryLimitExceededException`. A test for CLR access asserts `JintException` or `SecurityException`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Ensures the reliability and security of the sandbox implementation.

title: Create Security Audit Logging Service
description: Implement a dedicated service, e.g., `ISecurityAuditLogger`, to handle the formatting and writing of security-related events using Serilog.
sprint_goal: Establish the core secure transformation engine backend and its foundational security model.
acceptance_criteria: An interface `ISecurityAuditLogger.cs` is defined. An implementation `SerilogSecurityAuditLogger.cs` is created. The service writes structured logs with specific properties for event type, script ID, and user context.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Provides security and operational visibility into misuse or misconfiguration.

title: Implement EF Core Entities and DbContext for Scripts
description: Create `TransformationScript.cs` and `TransformationScriptVersion.cs` entity classes. Define properties and relationships (one-to-many, FKs). Add `DbSet` properties to `AppDbContext`.
sprint_goal: Implement backend for script management and data handling pipeline.
acceptance_criteria: Entities are created with all required properties. Relationships are correctly configured. The project builds successfully.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Establishes the data foundation for storing and versioning all transformation logic.

title: Research and POC for Monaco Editor Integration
description: Evaluate the `@monaco-editor/react` package. Create a small proof-of-concept to understand its API, configuration options, and potential impact on application bundle size.
sprint_goal: Develop the core frontend UI for script management and previewing.
acceptance_criteria: A simple React component successfully renders the Monaco editor. The POC demonstrates how to set the language to JavaScript. The POC demonstrates two-way data binding. Bundle size impact is measured and documented.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Provides a professional-grade editing experience, improving administrator efficiency and reducing errors.

title: Develop Version History Component
description: Create a React component (e.g., a modal or drawer) that fetches and displays the version history for a script from the `GET .../{id}/versions` API. The list should show version number, timestamp, and user.
sprint_goal: Enhance UI with versioning and complete the script preview workflow.
acceptance_criteria: The component correctly fetches and renders the list of versions. It includes checkboxes for selection. It includes a 'Compare' button, disabled unless exactly two versions are checked. It includes a 'Revert' button on each historical version.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Provides a safety net for administrators, allowing them to audit changes and quickly recover from mistakes.

title: Implement JSON Schema Validation Service
description: Create a service that uses a library like `JsonSchema.Net` to validate a `JsonNode` against a schema string. The service should return a structured validation result.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced data handling features, operations, and compliance checks.
acceptance_criteria: The service accepts a `JsonNode` and a schema string. It returns a result object indicating success or failure. On failure, the result object contains a list of validation errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
business_value: Enforces data contracts and ensures data quality for downstream systems.

title: Document Backup and Recovery Runbook
description: Write a step-by-step markdown document detailing the procedures for backing up the SQLite database and restoring it on a new server.
sprint_goal: Finalize operational documentation and prepare for production lifecycle management.
acceptance_criteria: The document lists all files/directories to be backed up. It provides clear, command-line steps for the restore process. It includes a verification step.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Peer review and execution during the DR test.
business_value: Ensures business continuity and data durability in case of catastrophic failure.

title: Implement Log Integrity and Retention Mechanisms
description: Design and implement a mechanism to ensure log integrity (e.g., checksums or write-only storage). Create a scheduled job to enforce the one-year data retention policy by purging old logs.
sprint_goal: Implement final compliance and life-cycle management features for production readiness.
acceptance_criteria: The design for ensuring integrity is documented and reviewed. A Quartz.NET job is created to purge audit logs older than 365 days. The application interface provides no way to modify or delete audit logs.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Code review, security review, and integration tests for the purge job.
business_value: Provides a compliant, trustworthy audit trail required for enterprise adoption and regulated industries.
